parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: Answer, bid, bring word, command. A primary verb; to speak or say.
To, towards, with. A strengthened form of pro; a preposition of direction; forward to, i.e. Toward.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.

parse: Verb - Present Imperative Middle or Passive - 2nd Person Singular
Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: From ek and apostello; to send away forth, i.e. to despatch, or to dismiss.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 2nd Person Singular
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
At a distance, far away, remote, alien. Feminine accusative case singular of makros; at a distance.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
Probably from etho; a race, i.e. A tribe; specially, a foreign one.
